results.title: Australian diary. No. 014
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Victoria converts brown coal to power and light at Yallourn in the Latrobe Valley. The mechanisation of Australia’s wheat farms from harvesting to transporting wheat to the silos is shown as the country celebrates a bumper crop. Army Minister revies a parade of school cadets from high and public schools at Ingleburn Camp near Sydney. Fairbridge Farm School at Molong in New South Wales helps new migrants create a future in their adopted country.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 008
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The progress made by sheep breeders is evident at the Sydney Sheep show. A burnt-out forest is salvaged for paper making in Victoria. John Seufert, a blind and handless soldier refuses to let his disability defeat him. Burrinjuck Dam provides water for irrigation in the Murrumbidgee River area.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 002
results.brief_description: This diary features Kauri timber in Western Australia, Sydney from the air - how it looks from four miles up, a motor yacht regatta, Kingaroy’s peanut industry, ‘Bernborough’ winning the Doomben race, and spring at Mt. Kosciusko. No credits available.

results.title: Great Barrier Reef
results.creator_credit: Kit Guyatt, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows some of the scientific observations of the Heron Island research staion on the Great Barrier Reef. Illustrates in detail the birds, fish and mammals of the area.

results.title: Australia calling
results.brief_description: A panorama of Australia, moving from Western Australia through South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria, the A.C.T., N.S.W. and Queensland. Scenes include timber getting, gold mining, grape and apple harvests, dairying, skiing, Federal Parliament, Sydney attractions, Blue Mountains, caves and beaches, cane cutting and the Great Barrier Reef.

results.title: Ride like a champion
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Members of a Police and Citizens Boys’ Club demonstrate faulty and careless riding of bicycles. A police sergeant instructs them in the correct methods and demonstrates correct hand signals. Shows how to maintaine the bicycle and how to care for the reflector, brakes, chain, tires and the wheels. A group-cycling trip is used to illustrate elements of road care and courtesy.

results.title: Journey of a Nation
results.creator_credit: John Heyer, Australian National Film Board, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and Catherine Duncan
results.brief_description: This film deals with the need for unification of rail gauges in Australia by showing just what the breaks in gauge at the States’ borders mean to the people who have to ship their goods interstate; particularly primary producers. It also makes a very lively plea for unification, treating its subject humanly, stressing the vital importance of rail transportation in a continent of such vast distances as Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Heyer, Australian National Film Board, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and Catherine Duncan

results.title: Big fish
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Bruce Cohen, Dan Jinks, Richard Zanuck, Cohen Company, Columbia Pictures, Jinks and Zanuck Company
results.brief_description: Adapted from Daniel Wallace’s novel “Big Fish: A Novel of Mythic Proportions” comes Tim Burton’s twentieth feature film since his directorial debut in 1971. “Big Fish” is a sentimental exploration of the ambiguous line between fact and fiction, as a man (Billy Crudup) makes a final attempt at getting to know his dying father (Albert Finney). Mythical tall tales told to the man repeatedly throughout his life by his father are revealed to the viewer with Ewan McGregor playing the father as a young man. A departure from Burton’s traditionally darker oeuvre “Big Fish” challenges notions that truth should be pursued before an embellished reality. Cast includes Jessica Lange and Helena Bonham Carter. Nominated for four Golden Globe Awards.

results.title: Australia marches with Britain
results.creator_credit: Ken G. Hall and National Films Council
results.brief_description: Highlights of the National War Effort. Reaping the wheat, shearing sheep, producing butter, eggs, felling trees for timber. Industry producing metals, Bren Gun carriers, shells, guns, ships, planes, exporting the lot to England. Total war effort to fight enemy. Australian Army, Navy and Air Force personnel training and embarking for service overseas. Commentary by Peter Bathurst.
